intro: Stadtmannia australis, commonly known as the Australian star flower, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces small, star-shaped white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Stadtmannia australis is adapted to well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments.
